title: Blessington Bulletin
body_text:
Blessington Bulletin
Death
The death took place on Saturday January 10 of Lorcan Mc Mahon, Santry Hill, Blessington and formerly of Bohernabreena at St. Francis Hospice, Blanchardstown after a bravely borne battle with Lung Fibrosis.
Lorcan was a lovely friendly man who always had time for a friendly chat whenever our paths crossed. He was well known in the area and will be sadly missed by all who knew him.
His remains were removed to the Church of Our Lady last Wednesday morning January 14 for his funeral mass and his burial took place afterwards in Bohernabreena Cemetery. Members of Blesssington GAA Club walked along the hearse and behind it on its way from Lorcan’s house all the way to the church which was a lovely tribute.
Condolences to his family at this very sad time in their lives.
Award for Valleymount stalwart John
What a proud day for the Valleymount GAA Club as they celebrated the Wicklow GAA County Boards Lifetime Achievement Award 2025 being awarded to one of their own John (Rocky) Stones.
John has been a cornerstone of the club for many decades and is one of their most loyal and passionate supporters. His dedication, commitment and countless hours of work have played a major part in shaping the club into what it is today.
The club is deeply grateful for everything John has given to the club over the years and this honour is richly deserved. He is a true legend. The club is immensely proud of you John.
Captain honour for Erin
Congratulations to Blessington’s Erin King who has not only been included in the Ireland Six Nations rugby squad but she has been named the Captain of the team. Erin has been out of action for almost a year having received a bad injury early last year.
Erin missed the Women’s World Cup last year which was no doubt a big disappointment to her. I hope that she can stay injury free from now on and that she will enjoy success with the team. The Six Nations will commence in April. What a difference a year makes. Best of luck to Erin and the Ireland team.
GAA news
Are you looking to get out walking in 2026 if so why not drop along the Blessington GAA Grounds on Monday nights at 7pm. The club have light up the track around the main pitch and they are inviting all residents of Blessington to come and walk in a safe environment for one hour every week.. There is plenty of parking and everyone is most welcome.
Also if you download the Irish Life ‘My Life’app to track each walk the club can compete with other clubs around the country to track the most kms. The club looking forward to seeing you next Monday night.
Blessington Wood sign
Just before Christmas a new educational sign was installed at Blessington Wood. The sign shares the story of Blessington Wood, its ancient past, its recovery and rewilding journey. The sign also welcomes visitors to this much-loved native woodland.
Next time you visit the wood take a moment to read, look, listen and explore. The wood is accessible via the Blessington Greenway via Poulaphouca car park. It’s well worth a visit. Make it your new year resolution.
St.patrick’s Day Parade
The St. Patrick’s Day Parade has been a great event in the town and much enjoyed by all who come along and line the Main Street. The team behind the parade work hard all year to make this happen. So let’s get behind the team this year and contribute towards the cost of the parade especially local hostelries who benefit from the large crowd that turns up on the day. Pledge a few bob to keep our great parade going.
Parish news
There are five churches in the Blessington Parish and please note that there a number of mass times at the weekend.
The Church of Our Lady Blessington and Valleymount Church remain the same times but the other three churches have mass changes. Lacken will only take place once a month on Saturdays, Crosschapel will have mass only every second Sunday and Manor Kilbride will also have mass every second Sunday. A full list is available on the parish newsletter or on line.
Disco
It’s Disco time again in Blessington on Friday January 30. The first Disco of the year organised by the St. Patrick’s Day committee will be on from 7pm – 9.30pm. It will be for 4th, 5th and 6th class in National Schools in the area. Admission will be €10 which will be payable at the door. An enjoyable night is guaranteed so make sure to pop along on the night.
Library news
Some good news from Blessington Library. They are now open again on Saturdays from 10am – 5pm and that means they are now open from Monday- Saturday, closed on Sunday’s. Opening hours are Monday, Wednesday and Friday 10am – 5pm, Tuesday and Thursday 10am – 8.30pm. New members are most welcome to join just pop in and sign up. The Library has plenty to offer.
Parish Lotto
Blessington Parish Lotto Draw took place on Thursday January 1 and there was once again no winner of the jackpot. The winning numbers drawn were 5,10,27,29The jackpot has now survived a number of draws. The next Lotto Draw will take place later in the New Year and it will have another new jackpot which will be standing at €3,000.
Contact the Parish office for details in how to enter the draw or you can check the parish website. All support will be most welcome. It would be a great way to win a nice few euros and who knows you might be the lucky one who scoops the jackpot which no doubt will come in very handy at this time of the year. The weekly winner won €25.
AFC news
Blessington AFC are looking to add some experience players to their Premier Sunday team who operate in the Leinster Senior League. They already have a very strong squad. If you are competitive, committed and ready to play at a high level contact Shane 083 0224452. Blessington AFC play their home matches at their Crosschapel Grounds.
The club are also looking for a manager for their O/35 team. The club will provide training through the FAI Coach Pathway. If anyone is interested contact the club at enquiries@blessingtonfc.com.
Donations have been made to Blessington and District Senior Citizens and the Kevin Bell Repatriation Trust in memory of Darach Keane from monies raised from the two charity football matches on St. Stephen’s Day O/35’s and AfC v GAA. Many thanks to all involved.
Choir
Blessington Millennium Choir have resume practice in the Kare Centre Blessington at 7.30pm. The choir began for the Millennium and it is great to see it still going strong after all the years. New members are always very welcome men and women.
Car Boot Sale
The first Car Boot Sale of the year will take place at St. Kevin’s Community Centre on Sunday February 22 . More details will be available closer to the event. Hopefully the weather will be ok as a number of stalls are out doors.
Car Boot Sales are not as popular as they used to be but the Blessington remains popular with lots of stalls and lots of buyers.
Some more local history
Here is some more local history of the Main Street in Blessington. Where there now is a Chinese beauty business. There used to be a lodging house called Henry Gray’s. Further up the town is theDownshire Monument and behind that was the market House which later on became the Court House. It is now the Credit Union.
Across the street is the old Downshire Hotel which once was a Royal Bank. Before that it was used as a residence by the Downshires. Price Albert the husband of Queen Victoria stayed there around 1858. The hotel hosted the wedding of gay Byrne and Kathleen Watkins. Across the road from the hotel is the four stone tree.
Finally beside the Garda barracks was the Coffee Palace which was open on Fair days to keep the farmers sober. Those were the good old days my friend we thought they would never end.
